[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Inter-CDN Peering defines requirements to optimize resource utilization, content delivery, and traffic management across CDNs.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Inter-CDN facilitates secure communication, traffic routing, and content synchronization among CDNs.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Inter-CDN integrates with DNS servers, edge caches, and CDN monitoring tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Inter-CDN provides dashboards for peering management and traffic monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Inter-CDN operates on edge servers, origin nodes, and exchange points.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Inter-CDN supports APIs for DNS, cache control, and security policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Inter-CDN uses encrypted protocols for secure data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Inter-CDN optimizes caching and real-time traffic processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Inter-CDN ensures 24/7 availability with load balancing and failover.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Inter-CDN configures for regional and global CDNs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Inter-CDN connects to analytics platforms for traffic insights.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Inter-CDN supports peering, traffic routing, and policy enforcement.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for CDN administrators and network engineers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Inter-CDN relies on stable networks and peering agreements.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Inter-CDN requires operational DNS and security protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Peering: CDNs sharing resources for content delivery.
Edge Cache: Stores frequently accessed content.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with DNS servers for traffic redirection, ensuring faster query responses and improved latency handling.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect to edge caches for efficient delivery and support adaptive caching policies to optimize content availability.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall route traffic dynamically based on network conditions (REQ-DB-002, REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide dashboards for managing peering policies.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The interface shall support real-time analytics.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 10,000 content requests per second.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall update routing tables within 1 second.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store peering policies and traffic logs.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support real-time access and synchronization.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow modular architecture principles.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The software shall comply with CDN peering standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 27001 for security.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall follow CDN interoperability guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically during peak traffic.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log critical actions for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Validates traffic redirection, synchronization, and compliance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Includes user manuals and API documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 27001, CDN interoperability guidelines, DNS protocol documentation.
